definition: residence of a noble/top candidate in the imperial examinations

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
(prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just

sentences.english: What kind of ticket do you wish: first clbum or economy?
sentences.chinese: 您想要哪種票，甲第艙，搶先。還是經濟艙？

definition: first-placed candidate in the provincial imperial examinations (old)
refers to academics employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards, forming the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院
1st rank or top three candidates who passed the imperial examination (i.e. 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2], 榜眼[bang3 yan3], and 探花[tan4 hua1], respectively)
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
the Book of Songs 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] and Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]/a cultured well-read person
provincial imperial examination graduate who ranked 1st in metropolitan examination (in Ming and Qing dynasties)
candidate for the Imperial Examination proposed by a tributary state
to pass the civil service examination (in imperial China)
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
2nd rank of candidates who passed the imperial examination (i.e. 4th place and up)
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
